definitions.definition: To point out ; to discover ; to direct to a knowledge of; to show ; to make known.
examples: The guard blew his whistle to indicate imminent departure.

definitions.definition: To show or manifest by symptoms.
examples: Great prostration of strength indicates the use of stimulants.

definitions.definition: To point to as the proper remedies .
To signal in a vehicle the desire to turn right or left.
To investigate the condition or power of, as of steam engine , by means of an indicator .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To point out ; to discover ; to direct to a knowledge of; to show ; to make known.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , medicine ) To show or manifest by symptoms.
( transitive , medicine ) To point to as the proper remedies .
( transitive ) To signal in a vehicle the desire to turn right or left.
( transitive ) To investigate the condition or power of, as of steam engine , by means of an indicator .
